AMERICAN TROOP3 THROUGH LONDON.Copy of letter from the American Ambassador to the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.(Circulated with reference to War Cabinet Slo, Minute 2.)Embassy of the United Sxates of America.London, August 15th 1917.-My dear Mr. Ealfour,I send you my very warmly appreciative thanks for your letter and beg you to convey them to the members of the War Cabinet as well.I am sure you will realize that however great may be the gratification of the members of His Majesty's Government at this symbol of American resolve, as you 30 well express it, it gave me an even deeper satisfaction.I have had pleasure in communicating your letter to the commanding officers of the regiments which had the honour to take part in this manifestation.Yours very sincerely, (Sd.) WALTER H. PAGE.
